snippet.title: Tweet of the Week, Vol. 12 - Tony Lewis Jr. thinks of his dad
snippet.description: Today's Tweet of the Week explores the 25th anniversary of an auspicious day in D.C. history

snippet.title: Prince William County community calendar, April 13 to 19, 2014
snippet.description: Spring Clean Up Day, Easter Bunny visits, Civil War encampment and exhibits are scheduled.

snippet.title: 8 things to do in the D.C. area the weekend of April 11-13
snippet.description: See the blossoms and the annual cherry blossom parade, shop for crafts or see country spitfire Ashley Monroe.

snippet.title: Prince George's County community calendar, April 10-16, 2014
snippet.description: Events include foreclosure prevention program, community health-care meetings and boating safety class.

snippet.title: Sex, movies and the desperate attempt to shock audiences. (Hint: it's not working.)
snippet.description: ESSAY | As filmmakers keep upping the ante to shock viewers, what's actually shocking anymore?

snippet.title: Wonkbook: What you need to know about the Supreme Court's new money-in-politics decision
snippet.description: The Supreme Court strikes down aggregate campaign donation limits.

snippet.title: D.C. community calendar, March 20-27, 2014
snippet.description: Environmental Film Festival, "25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee," Pre-Cherry Blossom events.

snippet.title: Lo Fang's musical journey took him all over the world, and now he's opening for Lorde
snippet.description: Columbia native didn't find success in D.C., but the multi-instrumentalist is soaring from his Los Angeles perch.

snippet.title: Nightlife Agenda: Free music at the W, the return of Scythian and a tribute to Biggie
snippet.description: The Going Out Guide staff highlights the week's best DJs, bands, dance nights and parties.

snippet.title: U.S. embassies, at your service around the globe
snippet.description: For Americans who run into trouble while traveling, the U.S. embassy is there for all your needs.
